application.name: reduce
application.description: This program will reduce a cube either by averaging pixels or using the nearest-neighbor algorithm. All special pixels that can't be resolved by the VALIDPER value will be set to NULL.

parameter.name: FROM
parameter.description: Use this parameter to select the filename. All bands within the file will be scaled down.

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: This file will contain the results of the shrunken cube.

parameter.name: ALGORITHM
parameter.brief: Algorithm used to reduce image (Average,Nearest neighbor)
parameter.description: This chooses the algorithm used to reduce the image. The possibilities are: average or nearest-beighbor.

option.description: Use pixel averaging to reduce the image.
opened Use nearest neighbor to reduce the image.

parameter.name: REDUCTION_TYPE
parameter.brief: Parameters used to set scaling values
parameter.description: Select between using a scaling factor or a total number of pixels for the reduced image.

option.description: Uses a scaling factor to reduce the image.

option.brief: Use a total number of pixels
option.description: User a total number of pixels to reduce the image.

parameter.name: SSCALE
parameter.description: This is the scaling factor for the sample direction. For example, SSCALE=4 will reduce the number of samples by 1/4th.

parameter.name: LSCALE
parameter.description: This is the scaling factor for the line direction. For example, LSCALE=4 will reduce the number of lines by 1/4th.

parameter.name: ONS
parameter.description: The number of samples desired in the output cube. This value must be less than or equal to the number of samples in the input image.

parameter.name: ONL
parameter.description: The number of lines desired in the output cube. This value must be less than or equal to the number of lines in the input image.

parameter.name: VALIDPER
parameter.description: This parameter specifies what percentage of the pixels need to be valid (non-special pixels). For example, scaling down by a factor of two results in a 2x2 window (four pixels) being reduced to one pixel. If VPER is set at 50, then at least two pixels of the four must be valid (50%). If this criteria is met, the resulting value of the output pixel will be the average of the valid input pixels. Otherwise the output pixel will be set to the input pixel which is closest to the center of the window.

parameter.name: VPER_REPLACE
parameter.description: When the set VPER variable is not met, this is how the pixel with be filled.

option.description: Use NULL value when VPER is invalid..
Use nearest neighbor when VPER is invalid.

example.brief: Reduce the number of samples by a factor of 2
example.description: Essentially the opposite of enlarge, this configuration for reduce takes an image and scales down the samples.

terminalInterface.description: In this example the sample scale is 2. Note that this implies that the image will be scaled down by a factor of 2, not scaled up.
